title: Merge Conflict 56: Take on ARKit
author: Frank Krueger & James Montemagno
itunes:author: Frank Krueger & James Montemagno
itunes:subtitle: Apple has blessed us with a beautiful API for augmented reality with ARKit and this week we investigate all of the awesome baked in, what you can and can't do with it, and look at all the awesome things people are already building.
description: Apple has blessed us with a beautiful API for augmented reality with ARKit and this week we investigate all of the awesome baked in, what you can and can't do with it, and look at all the awesome things people are already building. Follow Us Frank: Twitter, Blog, GitHub James: Twitter, Blog, GitHub Music : Amethyst Seer - Citrine by Adventureface Proudly recorded on Zencastr
content:encoded:
Apple has blessed us with a beautiful API for augmented reality with ARKit and this week we investigate all of the awesome baked in, what you can and can't do with it, and look at all the awesome things people are already building.

Follow Us

  • Frank: Twitter, Blog, GitHub
  • James: Twitter, Blog, GitHub
  • Music : Amethyst Seer - Citrine by Adventureface
  • Proudly recorded on Zencastr

Sponsored By:

  • Raygun: Everything developers of any application need for native and managed crash reporting to detect and diagnose software errors.
  • Telerik: Telerik UI for Xamarin is a collection of visually stunning controls for non-trivial UI scenarios. Truly native, truly cross-platform UI for all your Xamarin apps. Developers can easily integrate UI for Xamarin through NuGet or VS Templates, and get to ship Xamarin apps faster with delightful UX. Try it for free and enjoy all benefits with industry leading support for a whole month.

Links:

  • Made With ARKit
  • Merge Conflict 2: Augmented Reality #PokemonGo
  • Augmented Reality's A-ha Moment - YouTube
  • Tango
  • xamarin/urho: Code to integrate with the Urho3D engine
  • Seeing AI | Talking camera app for those with a visual impairment
